revised_title: Digestive Changes of Fibrinogen and Fibrin: A Study on the Effects of Digestion on Proteid Substances
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of digestion on fibrinogen and fibrin, discovering that they are easily soluble in water and can be converted into fibrin under certain conditions. They also find that fibrin contains lecithin, and that the difference in behavior between fibrinogen and fibrin towards artificial gastric juice suggests a different relationship between lecithin and proteid in the two substances.
